meanings.definition: A sloping surface joining two different levels.
meanings.sent1: The wheelchair user easily rolled up the ramps to enter the building.
meanings.sent2: The workers built sturdy ramps for the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The skateboarder attempted to ollie over the ramps but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: His heart raced as he drove up the ramps of the rollercoaster.
meanings.sent5: The ramps of the pyramid were steep and challenging to climb.

meanings.definition: A plant with a pungent taste used in cooking.
meanings.sent1: The chef added fresh ramps to the soup for a burst of flavor.
meanings.sent2: The farmers harvested wild ramps from the forest.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater wrinkled his nose at the smell of the ramps in the dish.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the sautéed ramps filled the kitchen with a delightful scent.
meanings.sent5: The recipe called for a handful of finely chopped ramps to be sprinkled on top.

meanings.definition: To increase or decrease in a gradual manner.
meanings.sent1: The temperature slowly ramps up as summer approaches.
meanings.sent2: The excitement ramps down as the event comes to an end.
meanings.sent3: His energy ramps up when he hears his favorite song playing.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room ramps up as the deadline draws near.
meanings.sent5: Her determination ramps up as she gets closer to achieving her goal.
